Question: In 1906, the British declared war against the Zulu Kingdom in Natal, this person encouraged the British to recruit Indians.
Hints: The South African experience exposed handicaps to this person that he had not known about.
This person had also refused to support the untouchables in 1924–25 when they were campaigning for the right to pray in temples.
This person took Gokhale's liberal approach based on British Whiggish traditions and transformed it to make it look wholly Indian.
